question.body: How would the body deal with reduced red blood cell lifespan to prevent anemia and maintain homeostasis?

multiple_choice.choice: increased red blood cell production by increased hematopoiesis
more iron per red blood cell
better usage of each red blood cell
using other means of oxygen transport

response.feedback: Correct. The body is stimulated to produce more red blood cells.
Incorrect. There is a limit as to how much hemoglobin, and therefore iron, can go into each cell.
Incorrect. There is a limit as to how much one red cell can do; that is why there are trillions in a healthy person at any time.
Incorrect. Oxygen is so poorly soluble in water that it needs to be carried in a special way, such as bound to an iron in hemoglobin

part.hint: In this case, the shortened lifespan of cells means fewer cells in circulation unless more can be produced.
